Info

    Christopher Norris is a graphic designer and strategist with 6+ years experience working as a creative partner across brand, publication, and digital design projects. With a focus on the intersection of technology, art and design his work includes non-profit, mission-driven, community organizations and academic institutions in addition to collaborations with design agencies and studios.

    From 2015 to present, he has worked as a co-founder to shape Alder Studio, a practice that supports this ongoing design work. Alder works with businesses and organizations to produce and manage design projects, events and social activations to create a more vibrant future.

    He lives and works in Burlington, Vermont.

Select Expirence

  • Alder Studio, Co-Founder (2015-Present)
    A multi-disciplinary graphic design studio connecting art, environment, culture, and technology. Responsibilities include creative direction, project strategy and business development.

  • Moran Plant, Creative Director (2014-2017)
    In an effort to redevelop a historic coal plant responsibilities included leading design projects including creating of a custom fundraising platform, community engagement events, and production of fundraising materials.

  • Fuse Marketing, Graphic Designer (2012-2016)
    Responsible for design development of both internal and client projects including Amazon, Mountain Dew Skateboarding, etc. Executions include print production, product design and marketing collateral.

  • Signal Kitchen, Designer (2010-2014)
    For the 250-person music venue and media production company, I led development of the brand for the live music venue as well as directed design for special projects including custom branded content and events.
